fields.name: Glen Scotia 25
fields.description: Maturation took place in refill bourbon casks before a final 12-month period in first-fill bourbon cask.

fields.name: Glen Scotia 21
fields.description: The nose offers tinned peaches, fresh ginger, and a slightly herbal note. The palate is voluptuous and rich.

fields.name: Scarabus 2020
fields.description: A whisky that will be ages in Port wood barrel cask for 10 years before release.

fields.name: Tullibardine
fields.description: The oldest expression in the Tullibardine lineup provides malt, cedar, stewed apples, and  truffle shaving.

fields.name: Glen Scotia 18
fields.description: New for 2017, this was matured for 17 years in bourbon casks before being finished in oloroso sherry.

fields.name: Kilkerran
fields.description: the nose gives a whiff of vanilla fudge, then black pepper, sea salt, and a savory note develops with a lingering fell on the tongue.

fields.name: Highland Select
fields.description: Magnificently powerful and intense. Caramels, dried peats, elegant cigar smoke, and  french oak.

fields.name: Glenmorangie The Cadboll
fields.description: At this age, there are more linear displays of fruit and sweetness than the 12 year old. .

fields.name: Edradour
fields.description: Though Edradour has acquired cult status, it has to be said that for a few years these Special Release were the talk of every bar in Scotland.

fields.name: Lagavulin
fields.description: Lagavulin is a classic example of how smoke isn’t a blunt instrument that covers everything in a fog.

fields.name: Fiona Mcleod
fields.description: What impresses me most is how this whisky evolves; it's incredibly complex. On the nose and palate.

fields.name: Islay Storm 2004
fields.description: An essay in balance on both the aroma and palate. Silky layers of delicate sweetness (honeyed vanilla).

fields.name: Macallan
fields.description: This is a whisky from 1970,  still aging cask, it will be available in 2021.

fields.name: Mossburn
fields.description: A whisky that just got into cask a perfect present , for anybody born in 2020, for  18 years from now.

fields.name: The Glenlivet
fields.description: An auld alliance renewed, this gorgeous whisky packs spicy aromas of peppercorn, star anise, and caramel.

fields.name: Scallywag
fields.description: Rich marmalade, gingersnaps, dried tropical fruits, vanilla pods, and cinnamon bark.

fields.name: Berry Bro's & Rudd
fields.description: With the Berry and Bro's 15 year old off the market, it’s nice to see a new one in the market.

fields.name: Rock Oyster
fields.description: What a surprise! Really thick and malty for a blend (there’s a high malt content here for sure).

fields.name: The Sound
fields.description: Antique gold. Gentle aromas of oak, caramel, and a hint of vanilla and sea breeze. Light-medium body.

fields.name: The 6 Islands
fields.description: Captivating, enticing, and wonderfully charming, this first blended malt from The 6 Island is definitely something to come back too.
